responsibilities: Performing engineering and computer science analyses related to ongoing Exponent work
Using deep expertise in physics, electrical engineering, or a related field to develop solutions to a wide array of challenging technical problems
Performing a variety of numerical analysis, modeling, and simulation activities to support engineering goals
Performing technical investigations of medical devices, software, and computer systems, as well as other platforms utilized for life sciences applications
Presenting technical results and solutions to a diverse audience through verbal, written, and interactive communication
Preparing technical proposals, pursuing business developments, and expanding the range of software-related services Exponent provides to clients
qualifications: Understanding of investigative analysis for troubleshooting technical issues and solving technical challenges
Experience with medical device engineering, development, or software
Experience with at least one common programming language such as Python, C/C++, Java, MATLAB, or similar
Technical hands-on experience with electronics, device hardware, robotics, semiconductors, optics, power systems, or measurement instrumentation
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, and ability to work independently or in multidisciplinary teams
Ability to gather information and convey technical conclusions to individuals in engineering, business, and related industry

Interest in learning and working with a wide range of devices and systems that span a broad array of consumer and industrial application, including both hardware and software elements of these systems
Desire to learn, and work with, a wide array of different programming languages, software frameworks, and tools
Ability to support multiple group projects and market the Electrical Engineering & Computer Science Practice and its consulting services
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on engineering and computer science analyses, technical investigations, numerical analysis, and presenting technical results. The skills required include programming, technical hands-on experience with electronics and devices, and excellent communication skills. While there is a mention of software-related services and a desire to learn various programming languages and tools, there is no direct indication of working with GenAI or LLMs. The focus seems to be more on traditional engineering and technical problem-solving rather than on AI or language model development or application.
